name: Tyler Montgomery
body:
email github twitter phone location
tyler@ubermajestix.com @ubermajestix @ubermajestix 303.919.7095 Lodi, California
## Experience #### [LivingSocial](http://www.livingsocial.com) ##### Senior Software Engineer | May 2012 - Present - Lead team of developers building LiveEvents product since launch in June 2012. - As tech lead I ensured the team was shipping high quality code through code reviews and mentorship with TDD and OOD. - Developed features cutting across all engineering teams, consumer, internal, and merchant, and mobile to support Live Events. - Built integrations with third party ticketing systems to allow LS to offer world class entertainment to customers. - Shipped flexible event registration product enabling LivingSocial and merchants to sell and produce events with over 10k attendees. - Produced several internal ruby gems to make development easier and faster for all teams. --- #### [Everlater Inc.](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/everlater) (acquired by AOL/MapQeuest Nov 2012) ##### Software Engineer | August 2011 - May 2012 - Built a white-labeled travel blogging and tour management platform written in Rails. - Integrated with Facebook to allow tour operators to market their tours with customer generated content. - Implemented and enforced good coding practices among the development team including TDD, writing documentation, and writing maintainable code. - Took tests coverage from 0% to 80% with over 1600 specs. - Wrote code in all parts of the stack including data migrations, models, controllers, views, css, html, javascript, Handlebars templates, Backbone models, and helpful rake tasks to ease development and setup pain. --- #### [Collective Intellect](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/collective-intellect) (acquired by Oracle May 2012) Software Engineer | March 2008 - August 2011 - Created CI:Insight, a text and data analytics product, allowing customers to quickly visualize searches from billions of social media documents stored in Solr/Lucene. - Created and maintained several internal applications allowing operations team to quickly mine data and produce research reports for large clients including MSFT, MTV, Pespico, and WalMart. - Built extract and transform layers in Ruby to import millions of rows of private customer data into Solr datastores for later analysis in CI:Insight. --- #### [Roundpegg](http://www.crunchbase.com/company/roundpegg) ##### Contractor | February - April 2010 - Created fully functioning beta product from photoshop product mockups and an existing Rails app. - Moved company from MySQL to Postgresql to transition to hosting on Heroku saving time and money over self-managing an EC2 instance. - Company was successfully accepted to TechStars based on the working prototype I provided. ## Technology Experience - Ruby since 2007 and Rails since 1.2.1 - Have built production apps in Sinatra and Rack in addition to Rails. - Experience building, packaging and distributing Ruby gems. - Extensive use of jQuery, javascript templating, and svg graphing. - Experience with several datastores: MySQL, Postgresql, Memcache, Solr, Redis, MongoDB - Testing experience with Test::Unit, RSpec, Minitest, Cucumber and Capybara. - Proficient in Photoshop and Illustrator. - Experimented with Objective-C (iPhone development), Scala, NodeJs, and Rust. ## Education #### The Colorado College (2006) BA Mathematical Economics Relevant Coursework: CompSci 1&2, Econometrics, Statistics, Linear Algebra, Macroeconomics. Each course is taken one at a time in 3.5 week blocks. Intensive immersion in each subject with steep learning curves has taught me how to ramp up on new subjects quickly.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
